subject: Re: Dynamically adding test classes at test-time
msgSnippet: I guess your own runner implementation to use with @RunWith could do the trick. To offer more concrete advice I need more concrete requirements ;-) Johannes
messageBody:
I guess your own runner implementation to use with @RunWith could do the trick. To offer more concrete advice I need more concrete requirements ;-)

Johannes

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Miles Parker" <milesparker@...> wrote:
>
> After doing a fair amount of research, I just can't seem to find a
> viable way to test classes that are loaded during test-time. For
> example, my use case is launching some tests from an Eclipse plugin
> test for code-generated classes.
>
> This situation is actually more difficult under JUnit4 because of
> reliance on annotations. I can't find a path that doesn't require
> class names to exist at compile time. Am I missing something?
>
